text_blocks.name: Custom units

is_math.name: Contains math
is_math.description: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.

distractor_rationale.name: Distractor rationale
distractor_rationale.description: Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.

rubric_reference.name: Rubric reference

sample_answer.name: Sample answer
sample_answer.description: A sample answer to be displayed on the Learnosity Reports API. HTML is supported.

acknowledgements.name: Acknowledgements
acknowledgements.description: References for any text passages, documents, images etc. used in the question.

stimulus.name: Stimulus
stimulus.description: The question stimulus. Can include text, tables, images.

stimulus_review.description: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.
stimulus_review.name: Stimulus (review only)

instructor_stimulus.name: Instructor stimulus
instructor_stimulus.description: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.

fontsize.description: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.

validation_stem_numeration.name: Stem numeration (review only)

response_font_scale.description: This scales the font relative to the question's font size.
response_font_scale.name: Template font scale

type.description: Keyboard style. See the knowledgebase article on formula keyboard types for more information.
type.name: Type

min_width.name: Response minimum width (px)
min_width.description: Controls the minimum width of the response input area, e.g. 550px

keyboard_below_response_area.name: Place keypad below response area
keyboard_below_response_area.description: When enabled, this will position the floating keyboard below the last line of the response area. Otherwise, this will partially overlap the response area.

feedback_attempts.description: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.

instant_feedback.description: Flag to determine whether to display a 'Check Answer' button to provide instant feedback to the user.

validation.name: Set correct answer(s)

allow_negative_scores.name: Allow negative scores

penalty.description: Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
penalty.name: Penalty point(s)

min_score_if_attempted.description: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
min_score_if_attempted.name: Minimum score if attempted

scoring_type.description:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question. Possible options:
'exactMatch': Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
'partialMatchV2': Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between the responses.
'partialMatch': Partial Match per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
scoring_type.name: Scoring type

unscored.name: Unscored/Practice usage
unscored.description: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

score.description: Score awarded for the correct response(s).
score.name: Score

scoring_type.description:

  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.

template.description: A string containing latex math to be rendered on initialisation. The template markup tag {{response}} is also supported. If present, only the {{response}} areas will be editable.

formula.name: Math formula [DEPRECATED]

text_blocks.name: Custom units

is_math.description: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.

distractor_rationale.name: Distractor rationale
distractor_rationale.description: Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.

acknowledgements.name: Acknowledgements

stimulus.name: Stimulus
stimulus.description: The question stimulus. Can include text, tables, images.

instructor_stimulus.name: Instructor stimulus
instructor_stimulus.description: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.

fontsize.description: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.

type.description: Keyboard style. See the knowledgebase article on formula keyboard types for more information.

min_width.name: Response minimum width (px)

transparent_background.name: Transparent background
transparent_background.description: Determines whether the area housing nested response areas should be transparent

feedback_attempts.description: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.

symbols.description: An array containing either strings or a nested objects of symbol definitions.

label.name: Label

title.name: Title

response_containers.description: Array containing objects defining each individual response container style.
response_containers.name: Response container (individual)

math_renderer.name: Math renderer

formulaV2.name: Math formula v2
formulaV2.description: The user can enter complex math notation.

text_blocks.name: Custom units
text_blocks.description: List of custom text blocks. Maximum length 9 characters.

is_math.name: Contains math
is_math.description: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML contents to be rendered with mathjax.

distractor_rationale.name: Distractor rationale
distractor_rationale.description: Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.

rubric_reference.name: Rubric reference
rubric_reference.description: A unique identifier for the rubric to be used with the question - defaults to course rubric if assigned in activity

sample_answer.name: Sample answer
sample_answer.description: A sample answer to be displayed on the Learnosity Reports API. HTML is supported.

acknowledgements.name: Acknowledgements
acknowledgements.description: References for any text passages, documents, images etc. used in the question.

stimulus.name: Stimulus
stimulus.description: The question stimulus. Can include text, tables, images.

stimulus_review.description: HTML/Text content displayed only in review state rendered above the response area. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags. Will override stimulus in review state.
stimulus_review.name: Stimulus (review only)

instructor_stimulus.name: Instructor stimulus
instructor_stimulus.description: HTML/Text content displayed when showInstructorStimulus is set to true on the activity. Supports embedded Feature <span> tags.

fontsize.description: Controls the size of base font for this question. Options are among 'small', 'normal', 'large', 'xlarge' and 'xxlarge'.

response_font_scale.description: This scales the font relative to the question's font size.
response_font_scale.name: Template font scale

transparent_background.name: Transparent background
transparent_background.description: Determines whether the area housing nested response areas should be transparent

feedback_attempts.description: If instant_feedback is true, this field determines how many times the user can click on the 'Check Answer' button. 0 means unlimited.

penalty.description: Value indicating the marks deducted for an incorrect response.
penalty.name: Penalty point(s)

min_score_if_attempted.description: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
min_score_if_attempted.name: Minimum score if attempted

scoring_type.description:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
scoring_type.name: Scoring type

unscored.name: Unscored/Practice usage
unscored.description: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.

score.description: Score awarded for the correct response(s).
score.name: Score

scoring_type.description:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.

scoring_type.description:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.

responsive_layout.description: Defines whether the feature item size can be scaled responsively

caption.description: Description of the audio being played
caption.name: Caption

metadata.name: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional data for the audio player

transcript.name: Transcript
transcript.description: The transcript for the audio being played

title.name: Title
title.description: Title text of the text audio player

no_controls.name: Hide controls
no_controls.description: Defines whether the user can control the playback of the player

no_play_icon.name: Hide play icon
no_play_icon.description: Defines whether the player's play icon will be visible

text.name: Text
text.description: Text content of the audio player

img_width.name: Image width (px)
img_width.description: Defines width property of the image

img_height.name: Image height (px)
img_height.description: Defines height property of the image

mode.name: Mode
mode.description: Mode of calculator to render. Values: basic, scientific

calculator.name: Calculator
calculator.description: Supply a calculator to assist users on mathematical calculations.

unit.name: Default Unit
unit.description: Unit of angular measuring that calculator renders by default, it can be toggled via calculator UI. Values: radian, degree

extended.name: Extended
extended.description: Indicate whether the calculator should display extra keys, including CE, square root, and percentage.

direction.name: Direction
direction.description: Direction for the counter to count, options: 'up', 'down'

title.name: Title
title.description: Title visible on the counter UI

template.name: Template
template.description: Counter text content, {num} denotes the location of the counter number

show_minutes.name: Show Minutes?
show_minutes.description: Determines the display format for the counter. If true then the format is mm:ss, if false only the seconds are displayed.

counter.name: Counter
counter.description: Embed a counter for pacing as an additional feature.

handwriting_recognises.name: Handwriting Recognises
handwriting_recognises.description: A string with the name of one of the available math grammar sets.

showHints.name: Show Hints
showHints.description: Whether to show hints or not

value.name: Initial Value
value.description: LaTeX math to display when rendered.

symbols.name: Symbols
symbols.description: An array containing either strings or a nested objects of symbol definitions.

label.name: Label
label.description: Label to be shown on the top of the keyboard in the LaTeX format. Use \text{} wrapper for simple text data.

title.name: Title
title.description: Title will appear as alt text or on hover over.

value.name: Symbols
value.description: Enter symbols to appear on keyboard.

container.name: Container (global)
container.description: Object that defines styles for the input container.

height.name: Input height
height.description: The height of the input containers including units. Example: "100px"

width.name: Input width
width.description: The width of the input containers including units. Example: "100px"

ui_style.name: UI Style
ui_style.description: Object used to control different aspects of the UI

type.name: Type
type.description: Keyboard style. See the knowledgebase article on formula keyboard types for more information.

min_width.name: Input minimum width
min_width.description: Controls the minimum width of the input area, e.g. 550px

input.name: Input selector
input.description: CSS selector for input elements which will receive the entered LaTeX math.

formulainput.name: Formula Input [DEPRECATED]
formulainput.description: Embed a powerful Math Formula Keypad to enable inputs of mathematical formulas.

image.name: Image URL
image.description: Supports a protractor, ruler-15-cm, ruler-30-cm, ruler-6-inches, ruler-12-inches or a URI to an image.

rotate.name: Show rotate icon
rotate.description: Renders a rotate icon that is draggable and allows the image rotate.

width.name: Width (px)
width.description: Width of the image in pixels. Can only be used with custom URI image.

height.name: Height (px)
height.description: Height of the image in pixels. Can only be used with custom URI image.

button.name: Button
button.description: Renders a button for toggling the image tool.

buttonicon.name: Button icon
buttonicon.description: Supports a protractor, ruler, generic or a URI to an image.

label.name: Label
label.description: Toggle button label text to display.

imagetool.name: Imagetool
imagetool.description: Embed an image tool as an additional feature to the current content. You can use your own image or the supplied ruler or protractor.

lexile.name: Lexile
lexile.description: The Lexile framework for reading is an educational tool that uses a measure called a Lexile to match readers with books, articles and other leveled reading resources.

flesch_kincaid.name: Flesch-Kincaid
flesch_kincaid.description: A grade level, making it easier for teachers, parents, librarians, and others to judge the readability level of various books and texts.

paginated_content.name: Enable paginated content
paginated_content.description: Set to true if you want your content to be paginated

is_math.name: Contains Mathematics
is_math.description: Set to true to have LaTeX or MathML to be rendered with mathjax.

instructor_stimulus.name: Instructor Stimulus
instructor_stimulus.description: It will be displayed above the sharedpassage's heading.

sharedpassage.name: Passage
sharedpassage.description: Enabling a highlightable text passage that can be used across multiple items.

math_renderer.name: Math renderer
math_renderer.description: Choose the rendering engine for math content within a question. Default rendering engine is MathJax with MathQuill for input areas. If you change this option to "mathquill", MathQuill will render all math content within a question.

pages.name: Content pages
pages.description: Content pages to display in the passage

items.name: Page {{index}}
items.description: The page to display in the passage. This field supports HTML formatted data, embedded images, LaTeX and MathML.

content.name: Contents
content.description: The content to display in the passage. This field supports HTML formatted data, embedded images, LaTeX and MathML.

scrollablepassage.name: Scrollable Passage
scrollablepassage.description: Enable scrolling on an existing content area.

data-type.description: Use the value 'scrollablepassage' for this field.

data-width.description: Width of the scrollable passage container in pixels or percentage.

data-height.description: Height of the scrollable passage container in pixels or percentage.

data-border.description: Whether to display a wrapper around the scrollable passage container.

data-subtract-height.description: A value which reduces the height of the passage container.

custom_type.name: Custom type
custom_type.description: A key that identifies this custom feature type.

js.name: JavaScript file
js.description: A URL to a JavaScript file which defines an AMD module for the feature. See this knowledgebase article for more information.

css.name: CSS file
css.description: A URL to a CSS file containing styles for the feature.

version.name: Version
version.description: A number that identifies the version of the feature e.g. v0.1.0.

customfeature.name: Custom Feature [DRAFT]
customfeature.description: A custom feature where the host environment is responsible for rendering the feature area.

metadata.name: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional data for the video player

transcript.name: Transcript
transcript.description: The transcript for the video being played

player_type.description: Defines the type of video player you want to create.

caption.description: Description of the video being played
caption.name: Caption

videoplayer.name: Video player
videoplayer.description: Embed a video asset to be used as stimulus for your context. You can use your own video or video hosted on the Internet.

src.name: Source URL
src.description: A link to your hosted video. You can upload an MP4 file (H.264/MPEG-4 is the only supported video format, this is the most commonly used and supported video format).

poster.name: Poster image
poster.description: A cover image for the video before it starts playing.

width.name: Width (px)
width.description: The width of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.

height.name: Height (px)
height.description: The height of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.

no-controls.name: Hide controls
no-controls.description: Set to true to remove the video controls from the player.

src.name: Source URL
src.description: The link to your Youtube or Vimeo video.

width.name: Width
width.description: The width of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.

height.name: Height
height.description: The height of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.

brightcove-code.name: Brightcove Embedded Code
brightcove-code.description: The brightcove code object that is generated by Brightcove
